page.title: 20Social Clubs in Cattistock
page.content: The Ceilidh Club is an informal association of no fixed membership holding occasional folk music evenings in the Savile Hall. Music is provided by local bands of folk musicians for dancing and singing and appealing to a wide variety of interests. The Camera Club has a membership of about two dozen, meeting in the Savile Hall every fortnight during the winter months to hear talks on photographic subjects. Photographic competitions are held both amongst the members and with other photographic associations in the county. Cattistock Women's Institute was one of the first to be founded in Dorset in 1917 and meets in the Savile Hall on the first Thursday of every month. There are 27 members, nine of whom have compiled this information.
